content.description: Queen's Gambit is the hardest route at the crag and first one you come to walking up the hill. Slap your way up the subtle prow using the crack on the right for your feet. The 4th bolt forces you onto the face and the tricky crux on good crimps. A gaston and undercling get you the lip and the mantel to the anchor.
content.location: It is the first route up the hill and climbs a red prow feature.

content.description: Prince Mushroom is a great, moderate, sport route on quality stone. It is a good option for beginner lead climbers. Start left of the bolt line, and angle up and right on all kinds of jugs. Step right at bolt 5 before moving back left through the heartbreaker crux on excellent white and black striped granite.
content.protection: 6 bolts + a 2 bolt anchor. This is easily toproped by scrambling around to the summit from the main wall.
content.location:
This route is located on a large, triangular pillar feature left of the main wall. From the main wall, traverse down along the cliff until you can scramble back up to the base of the route.

NOTE: there was a group of bull snakes in the holly bush below the climb when we were there. Please try not to disturb them, they are completely harmless.

content.description: Lady climbs very similar to its neighbor, although it may be a bit easier overall. It has a steep bouldery start, some vertical climbing, then a slab to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a shared 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
A small wall, below and to the looker's right of the main part of Kingfin crag, hosts

Gentleman

and Lady. Lady is the right line.

content.description: Knight is a must do route and the first one at the crag. Ramble up the broken ledges to the 1st bolt. Engage a tricky crux past the 2nd bolt on a bad sloper. Continuous 5.11 climbing leads to another crux through a thin seam. Keep it together for the final mantel thrutch to the clipping holds for the anchor.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the Main Wall, just right of

Dutchess

.

content.description: Jughead ascends the aesthetic arete feature on a small pillar. Fun climbing up the arete leads to a cruxy move to the massive jug at the top of the prow.
content.location: It is located on the right side of the hill side on a free standing pillar feature.

content.description: Boulder through a steep start, and then make a fun, slabby mantel at the top as you near the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts (maybe 5?, but thought I only counted 4) to a shared 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
A small wall, below and to the lookerâ€™s right of the main part of Kingfin crag, hosts Gentleman and

Lady

. Gentleman is the left line. Take a look at the main topo photo for a better idea.

climbs.name: Esquire
climbs.fa: B. Scott, J. Tarry, L. Van Weddingen

content.description: Esquire is the easiest route on the wall and still packs a punch above the 2nd bolt. The climbing is much easier after but stays sustained all the way to the anchor.
content.location: It is on the right side of the Main Wall. Scramble up a subtle gully and some ledges to the 1st bolt.

content.description: Dutchess is one of the better routes on the wall. It has technical climbing on interesting grips and good stone.
content.location: This is the 2nd route from the left on the Main Wall.

content.description: Duke is the hardest route on the main wall, and it tackles a tricky bulge low on the route. The climbing is easier to the top on very nice stone.
content.location: This is the leftmost route at the Main Wall.

content.description: Layback your way up the chossy wide crack. Baron is surprisingly steep and pumpy.
content.location:
It is next to

Queen's Gambit

on the first wall up the hill.
